title: SpaceX adjusts Starlink monthly pricing for residential customers based on service capacity
summary: Elon Musk’s SpaceX rolled out new pricing for residential Starlink customers based on its capacity to deliver service, according to emails to customers reviewed by CNBC.

title: Capella teams with analytics firms to promote use of radar imagery
summary: ORLANDO — Capella Space, a company that operates a constellation of synthetic aperture radar (SAR) imaging satellites, is partnering with data analytics firms to help increase access to SAR imagery, the company announced Feb. 22. SAR is a specialized form of remote sensing that has seen growing demand as SAR satellites can capture images at […]

title: Terran Orbital stock surges after winning $2.4 billion contract to build satellites for Rivada
summary: Terran Orbital shares surged in early trading on Wednesday, after the company announced a $2.4 billion contract to build communications satellites for Rivada Space Networks.

title: Crew-6 launch slips as Progress leak investigation continues
summary: NASA has delayed the launch of a commercial crew mission to the International Space Station by a day to give SpaceX additional time to complete work on the vehicle.

title: Space Force: Smaller launchers made case to compete for national security contracts
summary: In its latest strategy to procure launch services, the U.S. Space Force is taking a calculated risk that new players in the industry will deliver on their ambitious plans.
